question:
Consider the following statements about Coastal Berth Scheme:
  1. It is an initiative by Ministry of Shipping
  2. The schemes aims to provide financial support from central government to ports or state governments for creation of infrastructure
  3. Under the scheme, 100% of the project cost will be funded by the central government
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
First statement is correct. Recently, the Ministry of Shipping has taken up projects worth Rs 2,302 crore for financial assistance under the Coastal Berth Scheme of the flagship Sagarmala Programme. Second statement is also correct. The Coastal Berth Scheme aims to provide financial support to ports or state governments for creation of infrastructure for movement of cargo and passenger by sea or national waterways. Third statement is incorrect The admissible financial assistance from Central Government is 50% of the total cost of the project subject to:
  • a maximum of Rs 25 crore for projects relating to construction/up-gradation of coastal berths by Major/Non-Major Ports;
  • a maximum of Rs 10 crore for construction of platforms/jetties for hovercrafts & seaplanes by Ports/State Governments & passenger jetties in National Waterways and islands by State Governments;
  • a maximum of Rs 15 crore for mechanization of berths by Major/Non-Major Ports
  • a maximum of Rs 50 crore for capital dredging of Major Ports/operational Non-Major Ports; and
  • a maximum of Rs 50 crore for construction of breakwater for existing and Greenfield Ports.
